content: ***this is a listing for a pdf printable pattern not a finished product**** meet anna the acorn she works up super quickly and is a great way to use up some of the smaller bits of yarn you have leftover from bigger projects from top to bottom she measures approximately 3 inches tall and could easily be turned in to a fun key chain using a different hook size yarn or gauge may result in a slightly larger or smaller end product you will want to be familiar with working in a magic_ring and using invisible decreases you can find the free version for this pattern and a full tips to learning amigurumi tutorial on my blog www graceandyarn com this listing is for the ad-free printable version skill level easy/intermediate - this is a beginner friendly pattern with some sewing of parts materials- size 4 worsted weight yarn small amount of beige and dark brown optional pink or red for cheeks 3 5 mm crochet hook 9mm safety eyes black crochet/embroidery thread for facial features scissors tapestry needle stuffing stitch markers abbreviations - us terminology mc- magic_ring single_crochet- single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet increase- single_crochet increase inv decrease- invisible decrease slip_stitch slip_stitch st s - stitch es you may make items to sell gift or donate with this pattern if you sell online please provide a link back to my website for credit as the designer www graceandyarn com you may not sell make copies or share the actual pattern thank you this pattern and more are available for free on my blog at www graceandyarn com this listing is for an ad-free printable version with a full photo tutorial thank you for stopping by
